alert.note: Alert for Sheridan; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 1:06PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Cherry and central Sheridan Counties through 1245 PM MDT... At 1205 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Rushville, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Gordon around 1235 PM MDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Highway 61 crossing the Snake River, Lone Butte, Irwin, Highway 27 crossing the Niobrara River, Intersection of Highway 20 and Irwin Road, Highway 250 crossing the Niobrara River, Clinton, Shell Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Rock Hill and Bayonne. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 83 and 138. Highway 250 between mile markers 29 and 48. Highway 61 between mile markers 199 and 231. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
